Reviews.Title: “Yes it's retro but it's very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: SusannahPK
Reviews.Content: Initially my husband and I thought this place was very strange given the 1970s deco and the massive apartment sized rooms all decked out in browns and whites with orange. But, the apartment is very spacious and contains a lounge room and massive bathroom with comfortable and large bath. The one criticism I would give is the very expensive price for wifi. It was €12 for 24hours and we had issues actually getting it free of charge as we were meant to originally as part of the Vaughan town program deal. We stayed here to participate in the Vaughan town program and would stay here again next time we are in Madrid for the program. Just try and see past the deco, enjoy the swimming pool and you will feel very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Summer in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Butterflybrain
Reviews.Content: So nice to have an apartment to move around in. Fully fitted separate kitchen, spacious bathroom. Conveniently placed for two different metro stops. Being in business area nice and quiet but only a couple of stops from Gran Via. Will definitely stay again. Didn't have breakfast as so much easier and cheaper to eat out in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, very tired, no extras but good location”
Reviews.Author: AviaMinnie
Reviews.Content: Definitely not 4 star and would barely be rate a 2. Very tired, the furniture is grubby (we used a blanket to cover the couch) but the bedding was clean. The Twin beds were not what we ordered but the reception staff didn't speak much English at all and being friendly was not in their job description. No safe and no internet in the room. To use the internet you put a deposit on a keyboard and use a terminal (there is only one) around the corner - you may have to queue for this. Kitchen equipment was minimal and the apartment lacked a washing machine but had a dish washer. No cleaning products were provided. Parking was available under the building for €20 plus tax a day. This accommodation was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to stay elsewhere . . .”
Reviews.Author: MplsJen
Reviews.Content: If you can afford to stay elsewhere, do so. The space was larger than I expected, but the room was not clean. Towels smelled of leftover cigarettes and a chair at the dining room table was broken. There are much better options in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Due for an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: always-l
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the others that this place is in need of an update. The place is tired and worn out. I stayed at the Eurobuilding 2 for 3 days. My apartment was large and so was all the furniture. The seal around the bath was black and the aircon did not work. Metro and bus stops all close by - and so are the restaurants and tapas bars. I do think this hotel is way overdue for an upgrade. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and decent”
Reviews.Author: gianpippero
Reviews.Content: Not far from tube. Large apartment style rooms, with living room & kitchen. The looks are dated, but quiet and clean

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Apartment Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReNee A
Reviews.Content: During my travels to northern Spain, I stayed at the Eurobuilding 2 in Madrid. I must say I was skeptical, because I read all of the previous mixed reviews from trip advisor and decided to try it out anyway. I really enjoyed my stay! It was quiet, my apartment was very spacious. It was definitely a home away from home. I liked the art deco style. It has a lot of charm and perfect for more than one person. My room was very clean and comfortable. I appreciated the option to include breakfast or not. I enjoyed the breakfast each morning and the staff was very pleasant and accomodating. As for the location of the hotel, it was absolutely perfect! It was walking distance to great restuarants, the metro the bus route drug stores, markets and etc. My friend and I felt very safe. As this was my first time visiting Spain, staying at the Eurobuilding was a great experience. As I am not bilingual, it would have been helpful if the staff, spoke English a bit more. I guess they could make the same statement about me, but we managed to work it out and it was a great hotel, which I plan to stay again. I am encouraged to take spanish class the next time;-)

Reviews.Title: “Simply horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: RSunset
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days and I would definitely NOT reccomend this place to my worst enemy! The receptionists are unpleasent and rude. The room service is a nightmare. The furniture is old fashion. The food at the restaurant would be refused by dogs. In other words, I WON'T GO THERE ANYMORE IN MY LIFE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill!”
Reviews.Author: sylvandr2000
Reviews.Content: My room is in disrepair, the paint is peeling off of the walls. I made reservations for a room that included breakfast but they don't begin serving until 8:30am. I had to leave for the airport at 7:30 but they still charged me 15 euros for a breakfast that I never ate. They charge 30 euros a day for wifi. I'll never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “average apartments but good location and nice roof pool”
Reviews.Author: casper53
Reviews.Content: For business in the Financial district of Madrid this is a good location at short distance from Metro station Cuzco. Apartments are a bit run down, but overall still in bearable state. Avoid the rip off on Internet charges (around 13 Euro/24 hrs!), go instead to nearby Starbucks (couple of hundred yards away). The Booking.com said there was free internet in the lobby, but it turned out there isn't. Plenty of places to have breakfast (Delina's across the road has free Wifi too). What made me choose the hotel was the roof pool. Great to have a dip in the sunshine at 18.30 hrs! Pool is well kept. Hotel staff was courteous at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KayeEdmontonAlberta
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Eurobuilding2 on a couple of occassions in November. The Eurobuilding2 is conveniently located in the business section of Madrid. The Metro was only a short walk pobably not much more than 5 minutes away. There are a number of eating establishments in the area as well as a shopping mall a few blocks away. I felt safe walking back to the hotel late at night. The staff at reception were always friendly and accommodating. My reservations were handled promptly and all my questions were answered prior to my arrival. I enjoyed eating in the restaurant on a couple of occassions. I found the buffet breakfast which was not located in the main restaurant was highly priced. The breakfast was not included with my accommodations, however, you have no difficulty finding breakfast a few steps outside the hotel for only a few eruos. I enjoyed the apartment style accommodations. The first suite I had was very large and comfortable, however, the living room furniture needs to be replaced as it appeared to be dirty and worn, so I avoided sitting on the couch., but I loved this suite with lots of room and a nice table in the living area and full kitchen. My second suite the following week was smaller and again very comfortable. This suite presented well with nice furniture. I would certainly recommeded the Eurobuilding2 if you are looking for a comfortable, clean environment with excellent staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but tired and noisy”
Reviews.Author: HarveyCapeTown
Reviews.Content: The apartments are in serious need of renovation. The kitchen has no kettle and you have to boil water on the stove. There is no safe in the room, the bathrooms need attention and the furniture is old and lumpy. Make very sure you ask for an apartment with an odd room number. The even numbers face Calle Orense and you don't sleep a wink. They are reasonably priced but very far away from anything a tourist to the city would want to see. It is just a short walk from the MEtro station though; about 3 blocks. I stayed there for practical business-related reasons and the good price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: tharsdim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eurobuilding for two nights in two separate rooms. The hotel is nice, but needs to be repaired immediately. In the firts room the heating did not work and in the second, rust was coming out together with the water in the bathroom. Also the internet 12 €??? Poor Breakfast: + The rooms are very spacey and with nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Big, but dirty and in need of an urgent make over”
Reviews.Author: Mandibulin
Reviews.Content: Big apartment, but carpet with dirt spots all over it, it looks that it has not been changed in 30 years so the curtains. No heating because they turn off central heater on May no matter if it is still cold........... All kitchen accesories were old and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMax
Reviews.Content: When we first got there some guy was upset because they double booked him. They kept saying it wasn't their fault and they can't give his money back. Also our room wasn't ready. Then when we got to the room the lights wouldn't come on. Finally we figured out that the key turns them on. Uh ok. He could of explained that. Also later that day I wanted to take a bath. There was no plug. So I called downstairs asking for one. They sent someone up that did not speak a lick of english and was talking to my boyfriend. I wasn't around. He didn't bring a plug and was trying show how to turn the shower on in Spanish. Which we knew. Don't get me started on the way you turn the shower on. It was ridciously complicated. Anyways after another phone call I got my plug. Then after I took my bath for some reason the water was still running even though I turned it off. Even the maid came and cleaned and left it on so the whole time we stayed the water was running. Also the bed had just one long pillow instead of two.Also they supposedly have internet connection but I guess they were having connection problems when we were there. Usually you pay for WIFI but because of connection problems it was free. The staff wasn't that friendly. But the hotel was reasonable. I don't think I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: markwHalifax
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel the staff were not friendly and infact were quite rude. We were given our room and immediately noticed that it had two single beds, we had booked a double. The reception were not interested saying the double rooms were all taken and they infact only had 26 of them. The room itself was fine although situated on the main road,the noise was unbelievable both night and day, the double glazing was nowhere near good enough. The room in which you had breakfast was situated in the basement underground this itself is not an issue unless like us you found 20/25 people smoking and could not see one end of the room to the other, needless to say we didnt stay. The swimming pool was both dirty and very cold and overlooked by about 100 other apartments. Madrid itself was too noisy and hectic, we went to Barcelona last year and loved it. My description of Madrid is like London but twice as busy.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: globalexecutive
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks ok before my arrival, I saw pictures by internet and were pretty good, but once I was there I have to say that it was much worst than expected. Apartments are in very bad condition, looks like a 2 stars lodge. Staff are not the modern management that someone expects in a 4 stars hotel, they are rude and not interested in providing a good service. Adult channels are not children-protected, any child with a control remote can select an adult movie, or even if you select by mistake one of these channels and see it for 2 seconds, when you check out they will try to charge you for the movie, that's unfair. I had to argue with the management as they tried to charge me for an adult movie that I did not see. Sorry but, never again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment Very Nice, And Confortable”
Reviews.Author: yaiza29
Reviews.Content: we stayed on 23 April in this apartament with my family. Very nice and espacious, with kitchen and microwave. also have laundry service and a good restaurant. just in Castellana, near Congress Palace. Excellent to bussiness people and families. swimming pool on summer.

Reviews.Title: “After 20 years some things don't change”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 days in Madrid during a 10 day tour of Spain. We stayed at the Eurobuilding 20 years ago when my family moved to Spain and thought it would be a fun experience to stay there again. The Hotel has not changed much in interim. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, which was very large but desperately in need of a makeover. The full kitchen and dining area were spacious, we didn't really want to cook in there but we could if we had to. There is a sitting area, dining table and 2 bedrooms each with their own bathroom. Having an apartment feeling was nice after staying in cramped hotel rooms for 4 days in Barcelona. There are lots of windows (have to open the drapes though). The whole place still smells of smoke and could use a steam cleaning (par for the course in Spain though). The furniture is the same stuff that was there 20 years ago! The Concierge was helpful and booked us a last minute restaurant reservation. If you want a first class service hotel this may not be your place but if you want lots of space for the price and in a decent location (right near Cuzco Metro stop) this might be your place.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurobuilding 2
HotelInfo.Address: Orense 69, 28020 Madrid, Spain
